website_summaries.verdict: A rugged, mid-priced option that is big enough for larger-sized people and comes with extras such as an emergency whistle.
pros: Comes with a nylon sack for storage, a 120-decible emergency whistle, and a 550 pound nylon core drawstring
Reflects 90% of body heat back to you
Good size, even for larger people
cons: Some reports of the carry sack ripping easily
Bag isn't very breathable, allowing condensation to form on the inside

customer_reviews.title: Fit my fully clothed EXTRA-LARGE frame and had plenty of additional room.
customer_reviews.text: The product looks very small, but unfolded, it easily fit around me fully clothed - with additional room. (I weigh 290 pounds and am six foot two inches.) Once used, I feared it would not be easily put back into the accompanying stuff bag. I feared for no reason because I put it back into the bag with no problem. We purchased 4 so we could have one for each of us. I do not regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Walk'n and Talk'n Classes

customer_reviews.title: It saved my 2 camping nights
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Live Bivy emergency sleeping bag as a back up thinking that I would not need it during my backpacking trip. At night the actual temperature was colder than I expected and my 20° sleeping bag was not keeping me warm. After shivering for a while I decided to pull the Life Bivy out of its package and then I extended it on top of my sleeping bag. I started to feel warm immediately. It was a great feeling to be able to sleep warm. Get one of these and forget about expensive sleeping bags that promise to work at low temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sainz

customer_reviews.title: This product works
customer_reviews.text: Right after I bought this bag I put it to the test. The first time staying out in 15 degree weather in the middle of the woods I put my trust in this bag and it delivered period.
customer_reviews.author: Ismael Soto

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect a sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. Arrived on time and in perfect condition. Unpacking it I found exactly what I expected- a space blanket. For an experienced survivalist like myself, this was exactly what I needed for the just-in-case. For folks that expect to use it regularly for extra warmth, you're packing the wrong gear and this bag won't last a lifetime. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: WesF

customer_reviews.title: Carrying case is more useful
customer_reviews.text: Probably the worst purchase I have made so far for my bug out bag. It ripped while taking it out of its bag. Honest the bag is more durable than the bivy itself. Disappointing product to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Molly B.

customer_reviews.title: So this happened... First impressions
customer_reviews.text: The paracord pulled out of the whistle before I could even get it out of the box. I can’t imagine what to expect from the rest of the product in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: FARRAN OUTDOOR SUPPORT

customer_reviews.title: Life Bivy...Space Blanket on Steroids!
customer_reviews.text: It's small and compact, very light weight. I have one right now but will buy more to put in different locations as needed for emergencies. The Bivy is about 6 feet long and 3 feet wide. I'm sure everyone reading this knows of Milar Space Blankets. The bivy is waterproof on the outside and has the same heat reflective material inside. It's essentially a waterproof, milar body bag for emergencies. There is plenty of room for most people to get inside the Bivy. Excellent piece of gear that everyone should have in their bags, cars, and anywhere else! I suggest getting more than one.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Reichart

customer_reviews.title: Compact and handy
customer_reviews.text: I have carried a bivy in my glove compartment for several years since I live in the northeast and it is handy for emergencies if I get stranded in a snow storm. My son got a job where he will be travelling on snowy upstate New York roads. I bought him this for his Christmas stocking. It looks well made and I will feel better knowing he will be prepared and warm if he gets stuck in a snow storm. He also likes to hike in the Adirondacks and I am going to suggest he pop this in his daypack when he hits the trail. Excellent product in a small compact size.
customer_reviews.author: C. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Literally, just an Emergency Blanket
customer_reviews.text: Bravo to their marketing team...but this thing is close to worthless. Your basic emergency blanket from Walmart for .99 cents is the same thing. Mine arrived ripped I think - or maybe it is supposed to be just a blanket folded up? No clue. Anyway, I would not recommend to anyone. Maybe if it was $2.99 or something.
customer_reviews.author: @HisNameIsSgt

customer_reviews.title: small pack, light weight
customer_reviews.text: purchased for snow emergencies (stranded in car) and evacuations. Very thin material. I stepped into the bag to check out the quality and size. I pulled the material to see if it would tear. It did not tear but it did stretch it out of shape and thinned it. My other concern is that while standing there I was able to feel how cold my tile was. It is long enough for my 6' 3" Sons.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly b

customer_reviews.title: Go Time Gear LIfe Bivy ER Sleeping Bags are great Product and Value
customer_reviews.text: Previously purchased two of these Go Time Gear Life Bivy Emergency Sleeping Bags last month and just bought two more this week. They are a quality made product, as good as any other on the market at a better price than others. Marketing is superior showing all details about the product prior to purchase and Follow-up after the purchase asking if we were happy and if they can do anything else for us is rare, and Impressive. Company owner really seems to care about their customer. I will continue ordering various products from them over others based on their business ethics and product quality. Quick service from Amazon and was in stock which really helps delivery time. Kudos to all.
customer_reviews.author: Randy C Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worse than a Garbage Bag
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most, I like to try out a product before using it the first time in an emergency situation. In the comfort of my own home, I opened the box, and a whistle fell out. What? Patent pending on what? I think not, and if for real, I would withdraw it because it's total crap. And the bag itself, I slid into, and it promptly tore from top to bottom. Tear resistant? Against what? All I did was touch it and it disintegrated. I would give this product 0 stars except being lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not great. It tore in one night and it got all wet inside the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Got it for Emergencies
customer_reviews.text: Never know when you are going to get stranded in the middle of nowhere. I bought it to shove in my daypack in case I ever get stuck out unexpectedly overnight. Considering getting a couple more for the car and truck. Hopefully I will never need to use it, but it looks to be everything advertised. Although it is a little heavier than the old mylar space blankets, I knew that before I bought it and was willing to accept a couple extra ounces for the sake of better durability and because the bivy concept should provide better overall heat retention than the old space blankets. Arrived well-packed and was shipped promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Somewhere in Montana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and a Great price too!
customer_reviews.text: These are a very compact, light weight, easy to use and restore into the carrying bag. A very convenient sleeping bag that fits nicely in my backpack. The quality is much better than my previous ones and amazingly at a much better price as well. I would highly recommend you get these now for backpacking or your bug out survival bag as I am sure the price will go up soon as the demand gets higher.
customer_reviews.author: DNS

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cheap cheap
customer_reviews.text: Save you funds and by the cheapest one you can find.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart In Two Hours
customer_reviews.text: Twenty bucks. Are you kidding me? Small tear developed along a seam as I as unfolding the product. By the time I rolled on my sleeping mat to get comfortable both sides split down to my waist. It was 44 degrees and it did seem to keep me comfortably warm until it disintegrated in less than ywo houts. Unless I got a defective one there is no way this thing could be used more than once. If I want something I can use once I can buy a box of cheap ones and toss them for what I paid for this. Glad I tried it before I needed it in a real survival situation. Save your money!!
customer_reviews.author: Harry Burke

customer_reviews.title: An Essential Component to ANY Emergency Preparedness Kit
customer_reviews.text: California = Earthquakes, and at the rate 2020 is going, I decided to be a responsible grown-up and finally put together a comprehensive emergency supply kit just in case we round off the year with another loma Preieta-style shaker. (#yayadulting) I chose this bivy sleeping bag based off the countless other positive reviews. I haven't had a chance to use it yet, and frankly, I hope I never have to, but I feel slightly more prepared for when that next "Big One" hits.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty LeNoir

customer_reviews.title: Just in case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Emergency Sleeping Bag to have in my car just in case the unthinkable happens. I live in the foothills south of Reno, NV. There have been people who have slid off the road during a storm and froze to death before they were found. It is small enough to keep in the pocket of the door of my car. It is there if I need it. I have not opened it to check it out but it does look like it will do the job if called upon. Better safe than sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Lew Van

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for extra layer for my winter camping gear. It is nothing more than a reflective emergency blanket in sleeping bag form. It ripped the first night using it. Had I known the quality of the product, I would have purchased a cheap $2 emergency blanket instead. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely convenient and fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to add a light weight mylar blanket to my emergency survival gear, and after watching several reviews on youtube, I found the life bivy to be a very highly recommended option. I received the bivy within a couple days after ordering from amazon. I was extremely amazed by the very small footprint this bivy can be rolled into. It is no bigger than the average man's fist, and can easily fit into your pants pocket. Since I bought this for my emergency kit, I haven't used it and hope not to ever need to, but I feel confident that this will serve it's purpose if ever needed.
customer_reviews.author: zircon

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the customer service and the delivery of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the customer service and the delivery of the product . I am travelling to Mt Kailash in TIBET , I want to be as light weight as possible and this works , it literally fits in the palm of my hand . Note that this is not a substitute for a sleeping bag , it is like a thermal sheet stitched together as a sleeping sack and it is only for Emergencies . there is no padding ,I am planning to use it as a liner for the Sleeping bag
customer_reviews.author: Umap

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan, too much condensation. Not sure what I would use it for.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I got what I expected, but I'm not a fan of this blanket. It is super thin. When it got cold one night, I put this on top of my sleeping bag, and the bag was wet with condensation in about 15 minutes. I wouldn't use one of these in any survival situation. The condensation that forms would be detrimental in a survival situation. Spend the money on the upgraded version the breathes. I'll be send it back and getting the breathable version by SOL
customer_reviews.author: Aidan, Noah, Dad

customer_reviews.title: Small, Compact, Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Life Bivy. I was impressed with the small size and weight, it seems smaller than in the video and pictures. Haven't used it yet and hopefully will not need it. But it is better to have and not need then need and not have. I took it out of its bag just to check it out, it seems to be well made. It folded up again quite well. I think I need one for the truck and another for the pack. I'm pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky T Mathiasen

customer_reviews.title: I PURCHASED THESE IN CASE THE HEAT EVER GOES OUT
customer_reviews.text: Hi, folks. I haven't opened these, they were purchased in case the heat goes out in my house. Ok, I will go open them now! They are light weight, I really do not want to unroll! My husband is ill and I wanted these to keep us warm in an emergency. They were shipped really fast. I trust that they will perform as promised. SOrry that I can't give you more. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: kathanhal

customer_reviews.title: It's for Emergencies
customer_reviews.text: Read some reviews.... It is designed for Emergencies folks. Yes you'll sweat, but be ALIVE. Tiny splits here and there? Maybe you should pack a -20 degree bag that costs $120.00 or more and is designed for every day use. Thank God you have it and Thank God that you'll never need it. Great Buy on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Sargekarter

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the Go bag.  Compact and light weight and nicely priced
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how it actually will work in colder weather since I haven't used it yet. But I opened it up and you step into it and it was tall enough for me to pull it over my head at 6'2" The material seems rugged enough that you can't accidentally puncture it with your finger I could see this working as a emergency bag or better yet combined with a regular sleeping bag. More importantly is that it is easily folded back up and put into the original carrying case!
customer_reviews.author: valdo rogers

customer_reviews.title: Tall enough for 6'4"
customer_reviews.text: It's a space blanket. No more no less. I opened it soon as I got it, got in. I'm 6'4" and 260, it's long enough to reach the top of my head but not long enough to be pulled over to my face. Packing it back into the sack was pretty easy, one person job. I'll keep it in my hiking backpack for "that one time" but for planned over night trips I'm bringing a sleeping bag
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great - hope I never have to use it
customer_reviews.text: Had a friend who got a little ambitious with a hike and ended up having to spend the night in the woods. He never actually slept because he was so cold - almost got hypothermia but fortunately didn't. Got home and researched emergency sleeping bags and now throws one into his day pack before every major hike - I decided to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: hgpilot - MM

customer_reviews.title: This bivy gives me a peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bivy for my grand kid, my kids and both of my cars and go bag. My son used the bivy while hunting while positioned in a static location. He said he fell a sleep and woke up in snow, dry. I depend on this product for the last ditch protection of all of my family members. I'm a firm believer in this bivy and strongly recommend this fir you and yours.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Eberhart

customer_reviews.title: Good product could be better
customer_reviews.text: I keep one of these in my hiking backpack as a just in case item. This bag seems as good as any others. One complaint I have is that they made the stuff sack so large. In the pictures it looks like its just large enough but in reality it could be 2/3 of its size and still fit. I just thought that was annoying because it wastes space and the extra bunched up fabric makes your bag look a little less organized.
customer_reviews.author: Pimpshrimp247

customer_reviews.title: Ready for winter in Minnesota!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the product yet, but I did buy three and they appear to be as described. We're about to have our first sub-zero temperatures and we've got lots of snow on the ground. I like to keep my car ready in case we slide off a country road in extreme cold and these seem sturdier than they mylar sacs I had in the car. Now my winter car kit is complete.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: OS Product!
customer_reviews.text: Timely shipping and receipt! Outstanding product. Perfect for compact storage in a day pack or larger pack. Perfect for quick access in the car, truck, ATV, etc for emergency situations if the situation arises.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! A must have for your emergency go-bag!!
customer_reviews.text: There were so many products to choose from on Amazon, it was definitely hard to choose. However, when I saw the Go Time Gear Life Bevy and reading all the reviews I knew this was the right product for my daughter and I. What made the final decision was the paracord and whistle. The product came quickly and is very lightweight to add to our emergency go-bags! Very happy with this purchase!! Thank you Go Time Gear for creating such a useful product.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Pham

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, great quality product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lightweight, reliable emergency shelter and several online reviews spoke highly of the Life Bivy. I thought the price was reasonable so I ordered one to test before getting more for the family vehicles. The design is straight forward and has plenty of room for a full sized adult. The package is small enough to fit easily in the get home bag and could prove a life saver one day. Overall I am very happy with the purchase and deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for out exploring in the winter time
customer_reviews.text: A good piece of gear to keep in your truck or quad while out exploring. It’s a bit thin but would probably work in a pinch
customer_reviews.author: David  fowler

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for our vehicles to have "just in case" either me or my wife get caught off guard. We normally prepare for the "what if" scenario but sometimes you forget to pack that one last item. With these left in the vehicles I know we can at least stay warm overnight. Highly recommend these to have as back-ups.
customer_reviews.author: Arcani

customer_reviews.title: Essential for disaster evacuations yet small/convenient to store and carry.
customer_reviews.text: I love how small it is as packaged yet big enough to cover me and keep me warm. It fits easily into my hurricane kit-so easy to grab and use. No need to carry heavy blankets-and it will keep you dry. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. CHANG

customer_reviews.title: True to Advertisement
customer_reviews.text: I go to Canada 1 time a year, going into the woods. The weather is always unpredictable. I also hate to admit it, but a few years ago I got lost, was not pretty. I will feel much better having this in my pack for a back up in case weather or any other situation goes wrong. While I have not used it yet, I have full confidence in it. I love the small packable size, its light and appears durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gear for Disaster Relief
customer_reviews.text: This is part of my Disaster Relief equipment, its compact and ready to go. This is one of the things that are important to me, because it has not happened, a disaster in our area, cheked out your previous reviews and I'll let you know more when I get to use it. Myself and anyone else needing a space to keep out of elements.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This was for my husband. He said, "I received the life bivy in perfect shape. Rolled it out and climbed in and it did everything that you said it do, I could feel my own body heat, in the Add it said it was pretty durable. And also rolled it up in the little bivy bag. I like it. I have in my emergency to go bag, ready to go!" I will try to add a photo!
customer_reviews.author: M. Y.

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a space blanket.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this product if you are looking for more than a single use bivy or a bivy you might need to use for more than one night in the wilds. This is essentially a space blanket tube tent that has been sealed at one end. One it tears or is punctured it will rather quickly self destruct. Again, not durable at all. For another $15 the Sol brand products are a much better value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It came when they said it was going to come it's in a real nice little bag you'll be happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I initially thought this was a blanket it is more like a sleeping bag where three sides are sealed and the top is open quality is exceptional and I will be ordering for more for the other for bug-out bags in the house
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: What All Homeless People Need
customer_reviews.text: I bought this waterproof emergency blanket for my adult son who is homeless. I cannot allow him to live with me because he's an alcoholic and drug addict. However, I could help him survive as a homeless person by giving him this compact, light-weight, emergency blanket. It's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Healthy Humor LLC

customer_reviews.title: Safety & warmth
customer_reviews.text: These were gifts for our adult kids. We bought them for emergencies for their vehicles. Our kids have to go over high mountain passes & have been stuck for hours on top of the pass. These are awesome for warmth! Made of great quality material, very small and portable. Highly recommended for travelers.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepin' rocks!

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I am traveling to Switzerland this winter, and will be traveling around a lot. I wanted a something small to fit in my luggage that would be a good back-up for warmth in any situation. This fits the bill - about the size of my fist, and I'm confident that if I need it, it will perform. Arrived promptly and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Compact and light easy to take along.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a road trip to my son's house. I wanted it for my emergency road trip kit. It's perfect for traveling since it is light weight and compact. I have not used it yet since I had bad weather coming up, the trip home has a chance of weather/snow. If and when I use this product I will update.
customer_reviews.author: D. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Compact Mylar tent and sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: If this is half as good as they say it is, this is a steal! I just got it last week so I haven’t actually used it; but it looks sturdy and it is very compact, folding up to be far smaller than a roll of toilet paper. I got it to put in my car for winter safety since I live in a very rural area. I hope I don’t need it, but I’d rather have it and not need it than need it and not have it.
customer_reviews.author: Larks abby

customer_reviews.title: Essential for bug-out bag, hiking/camping, etc.
customer_reviews.text: Great seller, great product. item arrived super fast & just as described. It looks great, seems rugged enough to not tear if I had to climb in it w/ boots on, and is large enough to cover my 6'4" frame. It's exactly what I wanted: a brightly colored, compact, easily-packable survival bivy to take camping, or just store in the bug-out bag or car for emergencies. i'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: El Mattador

customer_reviews.title: Buggout Item
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an extreme buyout bag. I can't give higher ratings because i haven't used them. They are for my emergency bug out bag. When I pulled in out of the bag, I was happy with what I saw.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L. Merkley

customer_reviews.title: Yep, it's good
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Nice item,quality material and it has a whistle on the end of the draw string. Perfect for the "just-in-case" scenario. Shipped quickly and packaged well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L. Tomk

customer_reviews.title: Hope to never use this!
customer_reviews.text: However, it's the perfect size for a go bag, a car emergency kit, or a winter preparedness kit. I know that if I ever do need this, it'll be there because it's price, size, and weight allow me to easily keep it wherever it might be needed.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Great for Emergency Bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product twice for my families emergency bags. Our priority was finding products that were lightweights and didn't take up a lot of room in our backpacks. This Live Bivy Emergency Sleeping Bag was perfect because it weighed practically nothing and was easily pressed down to fit into one of the smaller compartments of the backpack. I feel secured knowing in an emergency I will at least have something to keep me warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: We use to hike in, tent camp, carry our gear...ah the good ol days. Now that we're mid 40's we have a motorhome. however, we still have that fighting spirit while hunting. this has been used in non emergency situations multiple times. we love it. Even while riding in our side by side... repels water,mud, weather, etc. We snuggle under it often while riding especially when the sun goes down
customer_reviews.author: mcgregor

customer_reviews.title: Quality Material and Workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my purchase of the Bivy Emergency Sleeping Bag. The product arrived in perfect condition and appears to be made well. Very pleased with my purchase. Everyone should have this bag in their car or in their emergency pack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to NH. Live Free and Freeze!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to write a review for an item you hope you never have to use but I purchased this to keep in my car after moving from NC to NH where the winters are long and severe. The bag seems well made, is compact, and light weight. Perfect fit in my glove compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Staying warm
customer_reviews.text: I stayed warm in it when our car quit and it was 30 degrees out so I am quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen R. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Keep them in my winter travel kit.
customer_reviews.text: Living in northern Minnesota I have a winter travel pack that I keep in my vehicle, I now have four of these because they are lighter smaller and warmer than a blanket. For emergencies while traveling from place to place in sever cold.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Bugout bag staple
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bugout bag. It showed up quick and was as described. The only thing that knocks it to 4 stars was the emergency whistle on the bag. It fell off the strings almost immediately when I first pulled it out of the box and is a pain to get back on.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Treadwell

customer_reviews.title: It’s there if you need it...
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used this product yet so I can’t attest to its reliability and honestly I hope I never have to use it. But it’s in my car and I feel comfortable knowing it’s there. I did open it and it’s what I was looking for. It’s compact and lightweight. Quick delivery and arrives just as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: KAR

customer_reviews.title: Toasty and Protected
customer_reviews.text: We needed to travel during the pandemic and were worried about an overnight stay in hotels so we brought these bags along and slept in them on the beds. It wasn’t necessarily luxury but we were warm and felt protected. And now after cleaning, they are packed away in our cars for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: StacyNelson

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight, that was an awesome surprise. I usually carry a Bevy for an emergency shelter but this is a good solution. In a pinch it will keep you both warm and more importantly dry. I have two sons in scouting and it is perfect for them on day hikes where exposure is a concern or there is risk that they may have to overnight unexpectedly. IT doesn't look particularly durable, but I view it as a single use item rather than something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my EDC bag.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 5 star due to the fact it is the perfect size to put in out bug out bag. I was surprised by it when I took it out of the bag. It was just what I needed in case of an emergency situation when the Mrs. or I need a little protection from the elements. Plus, it helps when you are outside at night in the South, keeps the bugs off your legs.
customer_reviews.author: David Connor

customer_reviews.title: Exactly As I Expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my emergency/72 hour kit. It's light weight, which means it won't add to your pack weight. In an emergency situation it would be wonderful to have. If you're looking for an emergency blanket option I'd recommend giving this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest life insurance that I know of!
customer_reviews.text: I have yet been able to use the life bivy. As for durability I don't know for sure how durable it. It does seem to me it is durable enough to get the job done when your caught up in those sticky situations. It is light in weight and best of all it is a small package as well. I like the fact that it has a little bag that can be reused for the bivy, and it has a little whisle on it as well. I would get it again! Never know when you might need one. 😀👌
customer_reviews.author: H2

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a good idea to me.
customer_reviews.text: I really don't have any information. I received it in as ordered. But I have not got to use it yet. Obviously I think it's a good product or I would not have bought it but I have not used it in the field yet. I keep it in my vehicle along with a sleeping bag in case of emergencies. But I will try it out next time I go camping
customer_reviews.author: fragger

customer_reviews.title: good quality, good price
customer_reviews.text: gift for my son's survival kit. I spent quite a bit of time comparing with a number of other brand products. Finally decided on this as it is just a tiny bit larger for a better price. Also in bright colors for rescue detection if needed. This brand had all the qualities.
customer_reviews.author: gee gayle!

customer_reviews.title: Compact and light
customer_reviews.text: I paired this with a Don't Die in the Woods Mylar 2 person test. They replace some regular Mylar blankets I always kept around. I have no expectation that this is a permanent replacement to a good sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hensel

customer_reviews.title: It does exactly what it says in the description
customer_reviews.text: I’m hoping to never be in a position to use this. But saying that, the packaging, description and the convenience of the Life Bivy is excellent. If anything, I made it more compact, inside it’s stuff sack, by wrapping it in an elastic band. All in all a good investment that feels, looks the business.
customer_reviews.author: L. Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Just in case of emergency
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. Very light and is as advertised, I am about to start a 500 mile hike on the way in France through Spain and need a light weight safety bag just in case. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Keith W. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Good backup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for a mountain climbing trip I have planned for Colorado this fall. Hyperthermia is death in a mountain-cold weather environment. I bought this as a backup if my plan for an assault onto on of Colorado’s 14er peak goes south! The product was as advertised and shipped promptly. The customer service was excellent and courteous! I am currently shopping their line of other products to purchase for my trip!
customer_reviews.author: Crazybob

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency blanket. Not sure if I agree with the reusability
customer_reviews.text: The product is good for what it is an emergency blanket. I don’t believe this could be used multiple times and stay in any kind of good condition. Especially for the type of use that I have for it. I am typically back country and do rely on my heat blanket at night so I don’t have to bring a sleeping bag. I was hoping I’d be a little bit more heavy-duty than it is.
customer_reviews.author: micah

customer_reviews.title: Very compact
customer_reviews.text: This is little more than a long plastic bag in a nice pouch but I can see where it could help if you were in dire straits. The whistle is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: budhead

customer_reviews.title: Survival Tents
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them yet. I was sold by the information about the tents, ease of setup, windproof/waterproof, weight, etc. I put them in my day pack, car, etc. for emergency use. I hope never to use them, but I feel better having them. I have several brands, and these seem to be best in several ways. I buy them for my family as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Small and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag as a lightweight alternative to a sleeping bag for my Bug-out-Bag. It takes hardly any room and gives me peace of mind to have something which will keep me warm and dry should I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Crawdad

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, prompt delivery
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, opened and tried it out in the house, and I was able to get it back into its bag! Can't really comment on durability yet, but looks sturdy. Worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Woodworker10

customer_reviews.title: Good emergency bag
customer_reviews.text: Product is very well made for the price and very light. It is designed for emergency use, not as a full-time sleeping bag. It fits well into the bag I carry. I hope to never have use it in an emergency but if I do I will be way better off than without it. Delivery was quick!
customer_reviews.author: chief

customer_reviews.title: Compact and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I haven't taken it out of the box yet for fear I wont be able to put it back in the way it came. It looks good, very lightweight and compact. Im putting it in my buyout bag for my car. I will update when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderlust

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for Your Emergency To-Go Bag
customer_reviews.text: The Life Bivy is a perfect item for your emergency to-go bag. We sail the remote waters of Alaska and take our precautions seriously, you can't lose with this little gem.
customer_reviews.author: Young L

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Durable, Warm
customer_reviews.text: Though I haven’t used it yet, Bivy is a very well made product and I recommend it for anyone going camping or to keep in their vehicle just in case of any unforeseen circumstances such as getting stuck in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Israel48

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Mylar blanket
customer_reviews.text: Way better than a Mylar blanket. While anything in your pack adds weight, an emergency item like this is worth it when you need something that works and works well. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kory

customer_reviews.title: Ready
customer_reviews.text: My son And I are putting together our back packs and added your sleeping bag thermal bivvy as an extra emergency item. I think it will do the job when needed thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: not as good as SOL
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed - I much prefer the SOL brand, which is better made and insulated. This IS a lightweight alternative and good in case of a survival situation, especially since the whistle comes with it, EVERYONE should have a whistle in the field.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mace

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and packs small
customer_reviews.text: Bought for bug out bag. Seems to be well constructed, light weight and packs up small. Haven't used yet, hope to never have to but comfortable in knowing I'm prepared for an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Edward T Gahl

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used the product yet and I hope I ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the product yet and I hope I don't have to but it came as advertised.It is also compact enough for the car are the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Frank W.Brodeur

customer_reviews.title: Would buy from this company again
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly as described and very happy with it. Tested it out when I first got it. Survived young kids and a curious dog with no damage at all. Also received an email from company to make sure I received it in perfect conditions. Worth 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: twins mom

customer_reviews.title: Super compact
customer_reviews.text: Hard to rate it because I got it to keep in my vehicle just in case. It seems lightweight and is packed down small so I can keep it in the glove box or console or fit well into a backpack. Only bad thing I can say is that the whistle sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a little over priced
customer_reviews.text: This item looks fine as well as the bag. I also purchased a similar item for about half the price without the little whistle and para-cord. A better whistle can be purchased for about $2. Lot to pay extra for a small piece of cord and a very little whistle
customer_reviews.author: Geo K McLeod, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Important item for your car emergency kit - Your Get Home Kit
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy emergency sleeping bag is a replacement for a similar item which I gave to my 18 years old granddaughter as she was preparing her Get Home Kit!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Nulty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for emergency kits!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for an emergency kit for my car. So light weight and small. Bought 3 all together: 2 for my daughter and I and one for my best friend who travels in bad weather a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Jules2z

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for use when there is a power outage in the winter months. Sometimes our power can be out for up to 16 hours. It could mean the difference between life and death. I am thinking of ordering another for my car.
customer_reviews.author: R. Valente

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these to keep in our snowmobile gear. What a great product- very compact, extremely lightweight and affordable! So glad to know we have added to our survival gear- hope we never need it but so glad to know we are prepared. Also not to mention the amazing customer service- the cofounder actually reached out to make sure we received our product and to make sure we are happy with our product- amazing! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Best by Far
customer_reviews.text: You can not afford to go without this. Have one in your bug out bag and in every vehicle you have. High quality and tuff as nails for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, Warm, Well Packed.
customer_reviews.text: At current, this product lives in my car. However, I will admit, when initially testing it, I was most surprised out of the box when the included bag to store it in didn't feel packed full. I was expecting that once I'd opened and used the product that there would be no way I could fold it down as tight as the machine would have to put it in the bag in the first place, resigning myself to finding a new way to store the Life Bivy, but was pleasantly surprised and pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good company to deal with.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 8 Life Bivys for myself and family members, prompted by the recent weather. Being trapped by weather in the car for extended periods of time is a possibility that can't be ignored, and the Life Bivy could literally be a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: sadazik

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Nice and lightweight...bought it for my husband's "go bag" and he loves it. He likes that it is durable and can be a shelter or a blanket .... Or more possibilities
customer_reviews.author: KM in EG

customer_reviews.title: Emergency use
customer_reviews.text: So I've bought 2 of these... they are for emergency use, not everyday use... so don't expect the comfort of regular sleeping bags. With that, like I said, I bought 2, and honestly I hope that we never have to use them
customer_reviews.author: Rian

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy to carry either in your bag or hooked to it
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my daughters hiking bag. She is very pleased with it. Don’t know about durability (and hopefully we never find out) We are very happy with the whistle feature. I am going to order another for my son.
customer_reviews.author: MandyLou

customer_reviews.title: Value for Money & Packable
customer_reviews.text: After much deliberation, I opted for Go Time Gear's version. I am very pleased with how compact it is in addition to the quality, color and functionality. I will be buying more of their products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and durable
customer_reviews.text: Not having any of the issues stated in the reviews so far. For the price, the weight and quality, these are %100 worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

product_meta.title: Go Time Gear Life Bivy Emergency Sleeping Bag Thermal Bivvy - Use as Emergency Bivy Sack, Survival Sleeping Bag, Mylar Emergency Blanket - Includes Stuff Sack with Survival Whistle + Paracord String
product_meta.description:
Ever wonder what you'd do if you got stranded in bad weather out hiking or on a road trip? Now you can be ready for life's unexpected events with the Go Time Gear Life Bivy emergency sleeping bag.

This survival bivy sack is engineered for survival featuring a compact, lightweight design and highly durable materials. Remove it from the sack and unfold it to use as an improvised survival shelter tent or sleeping bag. Our survival bivvy sack is the only one with our patent pending Para-Synch Technology paracord drawstring utility rope and a 120-decibel emergency whistle.

 1-person bivy sack functions as a emergency blanket, survival sleeping bag, or survival shelter
Includes patent pending Para-Synch Technology paracord drawstring & 120-decibel survival whistle
Extra-thick 26um polyethylene material
Durable, tear-resistant and weather-resistant
Reflective interior reflects up to 90% of your body heat
Seam-sealed edges keep wind, rain, and snow out
Bright orange color maximizes your visibility to rescuers
Reusable thermal bivy sack folds up into waterproof stuff sack
All items are 100% reusable
Lightweight — just 4.1 ounces


Whether pounding rain, howling wind, or relentless snow, harsh weather is no match for the Go Time Gear Life Bivy emergency sleeping bag. It's designed to provide protection against the elements keeping you warm and dry.

Toss a survival bivy bag in your car's trunk or glovebox or keep a couple at home or the office to be ready for the unexpected. Your emergency bivy sack is also ideal for a winter survival kit, emergency kit, or bug out bag supplies. When you're done with it, simply fold it up and tuck it back into your stuff sack for next time.

No more worries about being stranded outdoors. With the Go Time Gear Life Bivy emergency sleeping bag, you're always prepared.
feature_bullets: STAY WARM AND ALIVE IN EXTREME CONDITIONS: The Life Bivy emergency sleeping bag serves as your emergency blanket, survival shelter, and emergency bivy sack all-in-one. Engineered for emergencies and survival, you have the ability to call for help using the 120-decibel survival whistle and the bright orange color alerts rescuers. Perfect for your bug out bag, survival gear, car survival kit, or bug out gear, the Life Bivy is an essential tool to ensure you stay alive in an emergency

PARA-SYNCH TECHNOLOGY PARACORD DRAWSTRING & SURVIVAL WHISTLE: The 120-decibel emergency whistle cuts through wind and trees alerting rescuers up to 1-mile away. The 550lb nylon core patent pending Para-Synch Technology drawstring can be used to secure or repair gear, build an emergency shelter, or start a fire. In a survival situation, your tools and skills are the difference between life and death. The Life Bivy's multi-functional stuff sack stacks the deck in your favor

EXTRA-THICK TEAR AND PUNCTURE RESISTANT MATERIAL: Your ultra-lightweight emergency bivvy survival sleeping bag is constructed of 26um extra-thick mylar material with a tear and puncture resistant coating so it stands up to extreme conditions. Your Life Bivy is durable enough for repeated uses so it can be folded up and placed back inside the waterproof Nylon stuff sack for your next adventure

PROTECTION AGAINST RAIN, WIND, & SNOW: Your waterproof and windproof survival bivvy bag is made of extra-thick tear & puncture resistant polyethylene material with sealed seams locking out harsh weather to cover & protect you in the worst conditions. The reflective interior of the Life Bivy emergency sleeping bag protects you from hypothermia and keeps you warm by reflecting 90% of your body heat back to you

ULTRA LIGHTWEIGHT & COMPACT: Small enough to fit in the palm of your hand and weighing just 4.1 ounces, the Life Bivy survival sleeping bag comes rolled up inside a durable waterproof stuff sack so you can store it nearly anywhere. Toss Life Bivvies in your hiking pack, go bag, bug out supplies, and glove box so whether you’re trapped in your car during a winter storm or forced to spend an unplanned night outside, you’re ready for the harshest conditions Mother Nature throws at you
